meanings.definition: Take (a machine or structure) to pieces.
meanings.sent1: He dismantles the old clock to see how it works.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic dismantles the engine to fix the issue.
meanings.sent3: The curious child dismantles the toy car to explore its parts.
meanings.sent4: She dismantles the argument with logical reasoning.
meanings.sent5: The detective dismantles the case to uncover the truth.

meanings.sent1: The carpenter dismantles the chair for refinishing.
meanings.sent2: They dismantle the tent after the camping trip.
meanings.sent3: The robot dismantles itself for maintenance, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: His words dismantle her fears and doubts.
meanings.sent5: The team dismantles the opponent's defense with strategic plays.

meanings.definition: Strip (a building or machine) of its covering or fittings.
meanings.sent1: The workers dismantle the old house to salvage materials.
meanings.sent2: They dismantle the car to sell its parts.
meanings.sent3: The wind dismantles the tent, sending it flying.
meanings.sent4: Time dismantles the once grand facade of the building.
meanings.sent5: The storm dismantles the fragile structure, leaving debris everywhere.
